Detailed Description

A planet's Atmosphere.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SG_Atmosphere::SG_Atmosphere (  void *  myPlanet  ) 
 

Constructor.

All the gas that can be present in at atmosphere are declared here. CAUTION: do not exceed MAX_GAZ (or you should increase this constant).

At-Nb Symbol At-Weight Melt Boil Density Abound-S Rea Max-IPP

Metals (here or not ?) - TODO

Complex gas : after reaction - TODO

Member Function Documentation

int SG_Atmosphere::calculateAtmosphere (   ) 
 

This function determines the precise composition of the atmosphere, and the proportion of the different gases in it.

Note: The function estimateAtmosphere() should be called once before.

int SG_Atmosphere::estimateComposition (   )  [protected]
 

This function calculate a first approximation of the atmosphere composition.

this function also updates the total quantity of gases in the atmosphere.

Returns:
The number of gases present in the atmosphere.
See also:
calculateAtmosphere

int SG_Atmosphere::getBreathability (   ) 
 

This function determines if the atmosphere can be breathed or not.

This function uses figures on the maximum inspired partial pressures of Oxygen, other atmospheric and traces gases. From pages 15,16,18 of Dole's "Habitable Planets for Man".

Returns:
The value returned is one of the value defined in the .h file (NONE, BREATHABLE, UNBREATHABLE, STINKING, POISONOUS)

SG_Gas * SG_Atmosphere::getGas (  int  rank,
int  stateMask = ALL
) 
 

This function returns a gas in the atmosphere.

Parameters:
rank The rank of the gas in the atmosphere (0= the gas with the highest ratio)
stateMask The gas can be filtered according to its status (GAS, LIQUID, SOLID or ALL) It is also possible to use expressions, ie: SOLID|LIQUID.
Returns:
This gas (or NULL if not found).

long double SG_Atmosphere::getGasAmount (  SG_Gas *  gaz  )  [protected]
 

Calculate the amount of a given gas in the atmosphere.

Parameters:
gaz The gas to analyse.
Returns:
The amount of this gas in the atmosphere.
See also:
getGasPressure

SG_String SG_Atmosphere::getGasName (  int  rank,
int  stateMask = ALL
) 
 

This function returns the full name of a gas from the atmosphere.

Parameters:
rank The rank of the gas in the atmosphere (0= the gas with the highest ratio)
stateMask The gas can be filtered according to its status (GAS, LIQUID, SOLID or ALL) It is also possible to use expressions, ie: SOLID|LIQUID.
Returns:
The full name of the gas. (or a blank string if there is no gas at this index).

long double SG_Atmosphere::getGasPressure (  SG_Gas *  gaz  )  [protected]
 

This function determines the proportion of a given gas in this atmosphere.

Note: The function getGasAmount() should be called once before.

Parameters:
gaz The gas to evaluate.
Returns:
The pressure due to this gas in the atmosphere (Unit = mB)
See also:
getGasAmount

long double SG_Atmosphere::getGasRatio (  int  rank  ) 
 

This function returns the percentage of a gas in the atmosphere.

Parameters:
rank The rank of the gas in the atmosphere (0= the gas with the highest ratio)
Returns:
The percentage of this gas in the atmosphere [0..1].

int SG_Atmosphere::getGasState (  int  rank  ) 
 

This function returns the state of a gas from the atmosphere.

Parameters:
rank The rank of the gas in the atmosphere (0= the gas with the highest ratio)
Returns:
The state of the gas. Returned values are: GAS, LIQUID, SOLID (or 0 if there is no gas at this index).

SG_String SG_Atmosphere::getGasSymbol (  int  rank,
int  stateMask = ALL
) 
 

This function returns the chemical symbol of a gas from the atmosphere.

Parameters:
rank The rank of the gas in the atmosphere (0= the gas with the highest ratio)
stateMask The gas can be filtered according to its status (GAS, LIQUID, SOLID or ALL) It is also possible to use expressions, ie: SOLID|LIQUID.
Returns:
The symbol of the gas. (or a blank string if there is no gas at this index).

SG_String SG_Atmosphere::getToxicGasList (   ) 
 

This function returns the list of the toxic gas of the atmosphere.

Returns:
The return value is empty if the atmosphere is not poisonous.
See also:
getBreathability
